business.headline: IMF cuts global growth forecast, cites 'significant slowdown' due to Trump tariffsThe IMF reduced its global growth forecast to 2.8% for 2025, down by 0.5 percentage point, while the 2024 forecast was cut by 0.3 points to 3%, down from the January projection of 3.3% for both years.

Tankup Engineers IPO: Check price, dates, GMP and should you subscribe?Tankup Engineers, known for building specialised vehicle superstructures, aims to raise Rs 19.53 crore through a fresh issue of 13.95 lakh shares.

'Gold is money': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu backs yellow metal as prices cross Rs 1 lakhOn Monday, gold June futures on the MCX hit a new high of Rs 99,178 per 10 grams, up nearly Rs 1,900 from the previous close. In the physical market, gold traded at Rs 97,200 per 10 grams (excluding GST), taking the final retail price past Rs 1 lakh after adding 3% GST.
Sensex closes 187 points higher, Nifty above 24,100; IndusInd bank down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 187.09 points to close at 79,595.59, while the NSE Nifty50 added 41.70 points to end at 24,167.25.

Gold prices jump to $3,500 amid Trump vs Powell dramaPrices of gold, traditionally seen as a safe-haven asset amid economic and geopolitical uncertainty, have risen by nearly a third so far this year.

Walmart-backed Flipkart to return to India ahead of much-awaited IPOFlipkart has grown into a large e-commerce platform that competes directly with Amazon in the market and is planning a public listing.
Gold prices are booming, but Dubai's iconic Gold Souk is losing its sparkleThere are signs of change amid rising prices for gold, as buyers look to diamonds and lighter gold jewellery, instead.

Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme ends on April 30. Resolve your income tax disputes nowThe Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme is all about reducing pending tax cases and giving taxpayers a chance to settle things amicably.

East or West, gold is the bestThe sharp rise in gold prices comes at a time when global markets are under pressure due to the falling US dollar and rising uncertainty in the US economy, especially after recent statements by Donald Trump.

China's gold ATM melts jewellery and sends money in 30 minutes. Check here The gold ATM, which is set up in China's Shanghai, melts gold, checks its purity and weight, and transfers the value to your bank account.

Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart may gain from US push in India trade deal: ReportIndia currently imposes restrictions on foreign-owned online retailers, including bans on holding inventory and selling directly to consumers. Domestic players like Reliance, by contrast, face no such constraints, giving them an edge in both online and offline retail.

Air India eyes Boeing jets rejected by China amid trade tensions: ReportThe Tata Group-owned carrier, which is undergoing a fleet overhaul and rapid expansion, is in talks with Boeing Co. to acquire several planes that were being readied for Chinese carriers before fresh tariffs disrupted their delivery.

entertainment.headline: Heartstopper bids farewell: Nick & Charlie's journey concludes with Netflix feature filmNetflix's LGBTQ+ hit Heartstopper will conclude with a feature film in 2025. The movie wraps up Nick and Charlie's love story, offering fans a heartfelt final chapter from creator Alice Oseman.

Taarak Mehta... actor Lalit Manchanda dies, television association pays tributeActor Lalit Manchanda, known for his roles in TV shows like Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah, was found dead at his Meerut residence. The news was confirmed by CINTAA.

Actor Hina Khan, a Kashmiri, reacts to Pahalgam attackActor Hina Khan, a Kashmiri herself, has expressed her sorrow and condemnation over the recent terrorist attack on tourists in Pahalgam through an Instagram post.

HIT 3 actor Nani says Arjun Sarkar was just meant to be a cameoActor Nani reveals that his role in 'HIT 3' was not originally planned as a full-fledged lead. What began as a cameo in 'HIT 2' evolved into the intense cop character Arjun Sarkar.

Rajinikanth, Big B, Deepika, other stars to attend WAVES Summit 2025 in MumbaiIndia's biggest film stars from across industries, along with the biggest names in the entertainment industry worldwide, will be attending the World Audio Visual and Entertainment Summit (WAVES) 2025 in Mumbai.

The Royals trailer: Ishaan-Bhumi's chemistry is ok, but we are in for Zeenat AmanThe trailer for Netflix's 'The Royals' reveals a fading city where a prince and CEO team up, leading to unexpected romance and drama. The series features Ishaan Khatter and Bhumi Pednekar and it will stream from May 9.

Sebastian Stan calls Trump 'narcissist': He must've seen The Apprentice 100 timesIn a recent Vanity Fair interview, actor Sebastian Stan criticised Donald Trump, labelling him a 'narcissist' and speculating on his obsession with 'The Apprentice'. Stan also discussed Trump's potential reaction to a film portrayal.

Akshay Kumar condemns Pahalgam attack: Sheer evil to kill innocent peopleBollywood actor Akshay Kumar has condemned the recent terror attack on tourists in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, which resulted in one death and twelve injuries. He expressed his horror at the incident and offered prayers for the victims' families.

Martin Scorsese to Leonardo DiCaprio, Hollywood celebs remember Pope FrancisPope Francis' death at 88 led to tributes from actors, filmmakers and other celebrities across Hollywood. Martin Scorsese, Leonardo DiCaprio, Whoopi Goldberg, Eva Longoria, Antonio Banderas, and Russell Crowe expressed their grief.
Saif Ali Khan buys home in Qatar after stabbing incident in MumbaiActor Saif Ali Khan recently bought a luxurious home in Qatar. The actor referenced that the place should be 'safe and comfortable.'

This wasn't a rule? Internet is shocked as Academy announces new viewing mandateFollowing the 2025 Oscars, controversy arose over voting practices, leading to a new rule requiring members to watch all nominated films. This change is to ensure informed voting after past oversights. However, it has sparked buzz on the internet.

Andor Season Two: All you need to know about the Star Wars spin-off show'Andor' Season 2 returns on April 22, 2025, on Disney+ (JioHotstar), continuing Cassian Andor's journey to 'Rogue One'. Expect time jumps, intense arcs, and surprise cameos in this thrilling Star Wars finale.

Sonal Chauhan on her viral IPL appearance: Didn't realise I was on TVActor Sonal Chauhan recently became a viral sensation after her appearances at the Mumbai Indians' last two matches at Wankhede Stadium. The actor has now reacted to the same in an interview.

Bigg Boss, Khatron Ke Khiladi to now air on Sony? Here's what we knowThe popular reality shows 'Bigg Boss' and 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' might shift from Colors TV to Sony due to creative disagreements. Ongoing discussions between the channel and the production house are currently on.

Bengaluru priest helms world's first AI film in Kannada on Rs 10 lakh budgetNarasimha Murthy, a Bengaluru-based priest, produced and directed the Kannada film 'Love You', which is being called the first AI-generated feature film in the world.

Agnyathavasi producer hits back at troll criticising film's poor promotionsKannada producer Hemanth Rao addressed a viral post blaming poor promotions for 'Agnyathavasi's' box office fate, defending the team's effort.

Mohanlal's Thudarum is a family drama, not a thriller like Drishyam, says directorWith audience speculation growing around the genre of Mohanlal's upcoming film 'Thudarum', Director Tharun Moorthy, recently stated that the film is a grounded family drama, countering interpretations that it might be a crime thriller following comparisons to 'Drishyam'.

Ram Charan's Peddi is a mix of real and fictional tales, says director Buchi BabuDirector Buchi Babu Sana revealed that 'Peddi', starring Ram Charan, is inspired by real-life incidents set in a village with rooted emotions. He confirmed that Charan approved the script in a single sitting, marking the start of their collaboration.

No Godzilla, no naagin, Kartik Aaryan turns Naagzilla in new filmDharma Productions and Mahaveer Jain Films team up for 'Naagzilla', featuring Kartik Aaryan in a fantasy comedy role. The film, set to release on Nag Panchami 2026, promises a unique storyline.

general news.headline: 26, including 2 foreigners, feared dead in Pahalgam terror attack: Sources Live UpdatesPahalgam terror attack: Terrorists opened fire on a group of tourists at the Baisaran mountain top in Pahalgam in Jammu and Kashmir. Twenty-six people are feared to have been killed in one of the worst terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir.

PM cuts short Saudi visit after J&K attack, to return by morning: SourcesPrime Minister Narendra Modi has cut short his two-day visit to Saudi Arabia, government sources said, after 26 people were killed in a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. He will leave for India tonight and arrive by Wednesday morning.

Hindus were singled out, shot: Tourist's blow-by-blow account of Pahalgam attackAt least 26 people are feared dead and several others were injured after terrorists from a Lashkar-e-Taiba offshoot opened fire on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalham on Tuesday afternoon.
Trump dials PM Modi to discuss J&K terror attack, extends full support to IndiaUS President Donald Trump calls PM Modi to discuss Pahalgam terror attack, extends full support to India

'Go tell this to Modi,' Pahalgam attacker said after killing my husband: SurvivorA man from Karnataka's Shivamogga was killed in a terror attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir, while on vacation with his family. His wife Pallavi witnessed the incident and appealed for urgent airlifting of his body.

Rare attack on tourists in Kashmir reveals Pakistan's desperationTuesday's attack on tourists by terrorists in Kashmir's Pahalgam is rare, considering the targets and the scale. Twenty-six people are feared dead. This could be a desperate bid by Pakistan, given the phase of peace and prosperity that Jammu and Kashmir has been witness to.

We were having bhelpuri, then terrorist shot husband: Pahalgam survivor's accountGunmen opened fire at a group of tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. A woman, who was an eyewitness to the attack, narrated the sequence of events as a gunman targeted her husband.

Live: PM likely to hold Cabinet meet on J&K terror attack today, sources sayTerror Attack In Pahalgam Live Updates: In a rare terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, 26 people are feared dead. Several tourists were also injured. Terrorists attacked a group of tourists visiting Pahalgam in Anantnag district of Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. Gunshots were heard in Baisaran valley, one of the prime tourist spots in Pahalgam, following which security forces rushed to the site. According to initial inputs, unidentified gunmen opened fire on the tourists who had gone for a trekking trip. Several top leaders have condemned the attack. Stay tuned with indiatoday.in for live updates.

After new Pope, world to get its first millennial saintCarlo Acutis, a British-Italian teenager, known as God's influencer for coding and creating Christian websites, was slated to be canonised as the first millennial saint on April 27.  With the death of Pope Francis, Acutis' canonisation will have to wait for now. Hundreds of pilgrims have been making a beeline for the Italian town of Assisi every day to his tomb, and offer prayers.

Video: Moment when terrorists attacked tourists at scenic Baisaran in PahalgamA video has surfaced showing a man walking in a meadow in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam as gunshots and the screaming of people are heard in the background.

Roadmap to final deal: JD Vance shares big update on India-US trade pactJD Vance announced that America and India have officially finalised the terms of reference for trade negotiations and termed it 'roadmap for final deal'.

Maharashtra rolls back order making Hindi compulsory third language in schoolsThe Maharashtra government withdrew its decision to make Hindi a compulsory third language in schools after massive criticism from Oppostion parties. Hindi will now be an optional subject, with Marathi and English being the priority languages.

Who are UPSC toppers Shakti Dubey, Harshita Goyal, Dongre Archit Parag?UPSC has released the 2024 CSE Final Result. Meet the top three UPSC toppers Shakti Dubey, Harshita Goyal and Archit Parag and check the top 25 toppers' list.

5-6 Pak terrorists attacked tourists, arrived in Pahalgam few days back: SourcesA terror ambush on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam left at least 26 people feared dead. Claimed by an LeT offshoot, the attack marked the deadliest strike on civilians in the Valley in recent years.

Pahalgam attack much larger than anything we've seen in...: Omar AbdullahOmar Abdullah said that the Pahalgam attack was "much larger than anything we've seen directed at civilians in recent years". At least 1 person has been killed and several injured in Pahalgam terror attack.

Setback for fugitive Mehul Choksi as Belgium court rejects his bail pleaA Belgium court rejected the bail plea of Mehul Choksi, one of the main accused in the Rs 13,500 crore Punjab National Bank loan fraud case. He was arrested in Belgium last week.
Stressed? Screaming into pillows can help, but...With the screaming-into-a-pillow trend going viral, companies are now launching "screaming pillows" designed specifically for venting.

PM says Pahalgam attackers won't be spared, asks Amit Shah to visit sitePrime Minister Narendra Modi, currently in Saudi Arabia on a two-day visit, was briefed on the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam by Home Minister Amit Shah.

Rishabh Pant vs DC: Rs 27 crore man fails vs former franchiseRishabh Pant had a bizarre outing in both legs against his former team Delhi Capitals. The LSG skipper's batting and captaincy was questioned in both legs of the game.
Why flying in and out of Delhi is suddenly chaoticAt the heart of the disruptions at Delhi Airport is a combination of infrastructure overhaul, weather changes and operational missteps

If Thackeray bhais join hands, it'll be for the betas If the Thackeray cousins, Uddhav and Raj, come together after a bitter parting of ways two decades ago, it won't be for themselves but for their sons. This could be the last-ditch attempt for the feuding brothers to reclaim Bal Thackeray's legacy and help Aditya and Amit inherit it.

Dad, maybe I could live in India: JD Vance on what son Ewan said after meeting PMUS Vice President JD Vance praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his warm personality and hospitality towards his family during his four-day official visit to India. He said his son, Ewan, 7, told him he wanted to live in India after meeting with PM Modi.

IMF cuts global growth forecast, cites 'significant slowdown' due to Trump tariffsThe IMF reduced its global growth forecast to 2.8% for 2025, down by 0.5 percentage point, while the 2024 forecast was cut by 0.3 points to 3%, down from the January projection of 3.3% for both years.

'We're thick-skinned': Supreme Court judge's remark amid judiciary rowJustice Surya Kant, while hearing a 2010 contempt of court plea, remarked in the Supreme Court about how attacks on the judiciary come every day and that judges are "thick-skinned" to deal with such situations.

sports.headline: Back from injury: Bowler Axar Patel makes immediate impact for DC in LSG winAxar Patel's sharp captaincy and gritty bowling helped DC clinch a convincing 8-wicket win over LSG, as the Delhi skipper stepped up in both innings to complete a season double in Lucknow.

Rishabh Pant tries to explain demotion in bizarre post-match interviewLSG captain Rishabh Pant tried to explain the bizarre call of batting at No.7 against Delhi Capitals. Rishabh was not able to express his thoughts clearly and said that he wanted the other batters to capitalise on the Lucknow pitch.

KL Rahul special forces LSG to capitulate against DC 2nd time in IPL 2025IPL 2025: Delhi Capitals completed a season double over Lucknow Super Giants with a eight-wicket win in Lucknow, as KL Rahul's composed fifty outshone a misfiring Rishabh Pant and a collapsing LSG middle-order.

Rishabh Pant vs DC: Rs 27 crore man fails vs former franchiseRishabh Pant had a bizarre outing in both legs against his former team Delhi Capitals. The LSG skipper's batting and captaincy was questioned in both legs of the game.

KL Rahul scripts history, becomes fastest to 5000 IPL runsIPL 2025, LSG vs DC: KL Rahul broke David Warner's record to become the fastest batter to the landmark of 5000 runs in the history of the tournament. He got there while playing for Delhi Capitals against Lucknow Super Giants on Monday.

Watch: Rishabh Pant scolds Digvesh Rathi after failed DRS vs KL RahulIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant's frustrating night against Delhi Capitals saw him lose his cool over a wasted DRS call by Digvesh Rathi for the wicket of Delhi Capitals star batter KL Rahul.

Why have KKR put up a sorry title defence in IPL 2025?Kolkata Knight Riders are looking sub-par in the 2025 edition of the Indian Premier League. So, why have the defending champions not been able to repeat their 2024 performance.

Hiding behind youngsters? Fans slam Rishabh Pant for demoting self in LSG vs DCIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant's decision to bat at number 7 amid LSG's collapse sparked confusion and memes. Fans were left frustrated as Pant's decision did not help his side build on their good start against Delhi Capitals.

Starc's T20 dominance over Pooran continues with 5th dismissalIPL 2025, LSG vs DC: Mitchell Starc once again proved to be Nicholas Pooran's nemesis in T20s, delivering a key breakthrough for DC and shifting momentum during a critical phase of the match in the IPL 2025 clash.

Mayank Yadav's return delayed, despite being named in impact player listLucknow Super Giants' fast bowler Mayank Yadav's return has been delayed. Lucknow, who were expected to get Mayank back for their Delhi clash, had to change plans midway through the game.

BAI urges former players to learn coaching and save Indian badmintonThe Badminton Association of India has urged the country's former players to learn to coach under foreign coaches. The BAI wants former players to learn to coach and pass on the Indian style of play to its players.

Why have KKR put up a sorry title defence in IPL 2025?Kolkata Knight Riders are looking sub-par in the 2025 edition of the Indian Premier League. So, why have the defending champions not been able to repeat their 2024 performance.

Hiding behind youngsters? Fans slam Rishabh Pant for demoting self in LSG vs DCIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant's decision to bat at number 7 amid LSG's collapse sparked confusion and memes. Fans were left frustrated as Pant's decision did not help his side build on their good start against Delhi Capitals.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
